p: In many ways the issue of VBDs and climate change in drylands epitomizes the challenges and opportunities suggested by the SESR frame globally. Dryland systems viewed from the SESR perspective offer the potential for exemplary models of adaptive management that combine VBD control and climate change adaptation. It remains a matter of their incorporation within programmes based on principles already articulated for sustainable dryland agricultural, pastoral, and mixed agro-pastoral systems [e.g.,Â [ 74, 95].
